criterion: Antihypertensive therapy where SBP >160 or DBP >90
Antihypertensive for diabetics if SBP >140 or DBP >90
Beta-blocker or CCB for stable angina
Appropriate beta-blocker with stable systolic heart failure
ACEI with systolic HF or documented CAD
condition: Systolic heart failure or coronary artery disease

criterion: Statin with known CHD, QRISK >10%, diabetes, or CKD eGFR <60
condition: CHD, QRISK >10%, diabetes type 1/2, CKD eGFR <60
recommendation: START statin - discuss with patient, consider for ≥85 years

criterion: Lifestyle advice for CVD prevention
indication: Smoking cessation, diet, exercise, alcohol moderation

criterion: Antiplatelet with documented coronary, cerebral, or peripheral vascular disease
condition: History of MI, stroke, TIA, PAD

criterion: Anticoagulation for AF with CHA2DS2-VASc ≥2 (≥1 males)
condition: Atrial fibrillation with CHA2DS2-VASc score ≥2 (or ≥1 for males)
recommendation: START anticoagulation - discuss risks/benefits, consider HAS-BLED

criterion: Regular inhaled beta-2 agonist or antimuscarinic for mild-moderate COPD
drug_class: Inhaled beta-2 agonist or Antimuscarinic (ipratropium, aclidinium)

criterion: Regular inhaled corticosteroid for moderate-severe asthma or COPD
condition: Moderate-severe asthma or COPD (FEV1 <50%, repeated exacerbations)
recommendation: START ICS - give steroid warning card for high doses

criterion: Long-term oxygen therapy with chronic hypoxaemia
indication: Improve survival and quality of life

criterion: Self-management plan with rescue pack for COPD
condition: COPD patients at risk of exacerbations
recommendation: START rescue pack to keep at home

criterion: Spacer device for high-dose ICS or poor MDI technique
condition: High-dose inhaled corticosteroids or poor inhaler technique

criterion: Pulmonary rehabilitation for moderate-severe COPD
indication: Improve exercise capacity and quality of life

criterion: Smoking cessation for all COPD patients
Levodopa or dopamine agonist in idiopathic Parkinson's with disability
condition: Idiopathic Parkinson's disease with functional impairment

criterion: Non-TCA antidepressant for moderate-severe depression >3 months
recommendation: START SSRI/SNRI (lower risk than TCAs in elderly)

criterion: SSRI or SNRI for persistent severe anxiety
condition: Persistent severe anxiety interfering with function, or social anxiety
recommendation: START SSRI/SNRI if patient declines CBT

criterion: Dopamine agonist for moderate-severe Restless Legs Syndrome
condition: Moderate-severe RLS (after excluding iron deficiency and renal failure)
recommendation: START dopamine agonist with lifestyle measures

criterion: Acetylcholinesterase inhibitor for mild-moderate Alzheimer's or Lewy Body dementia
condition: Mild-moderate Alzheimer's dementia or Lewy Body dementia (rivastigmine)
recommendation: START after specialist review - use Donepezil first-line

criterion: Strong opioids for moderate-severe pain
condition: Moderate-severe pain where paracetamol/NSAIDs/weak opioids ineffective
recommendation: START strong opioid - use morphine first-line

criterion: Laxatives with regular opioids
Psychological interventions for mental health conditions
condition: Depression, anxiety, PTSD, psychosis, bipolar disorder

criterion: PPI at full dose for severe oesophagitis or stricture
condition: Severe grade oesophagitis or oesophageal stricture requiring dilation
recommendation: START PPI full dose initially 8 weeks, then maintenance if resolved

criterion: PPI for patients on antiplatelet/SSRI/corticosteroid/NSAID
condition: Patients on high GI bleeding risk medications
recommendation: START PPI (especially if combination of risk drugs)

criterion: Fibre supplements for diverticulosis with constipation
Lifestyle advice for reflux or dyspepsia
recommendation: START healthy eating, weight reduction, smoking cessation advice

criterion: ACEI or ARB in diabetes with renal disease
Bisphosphonate + Vit D + Ca for long-term corticosteroid therapy
Vitamin D + Calcium for osteoporosis/fragility fractures
drug_class: Vitamin D and Calcium (if dietary intake inadequate)
condition: Known osteoporosis, previous fragility fractures, BMD T-score <-2.5

criterion: Vitamin D + Calcium for housebound/falls/osteopenia
condition: Older people who are housebound, experiencing falls, or osteopenia (T-score -1 to -2.5)

criterion: Bone anti-resorptive therapy for documented osteoporosis
condition: Documented osteoporosis (BMD T-score <-2.5) and/or fragility fracture

criterion: Personalized diabetes management plan
indication: Glycemic control and CV risk reduction
recommendation: START personalized plan: diet, exercise, weight loss, smoking/alcohol advice

criterion: Diabetes group education programme
Topical vaginal oestrogen for symptomatic atrophic vaginitis
Alpha-blocker for symptomatic prostatism
5-alpha reductase inhibitor for symptomatic prostatism
Lifestyle advice for overactive bladder in women
recommendation: START caffeine reduction, fluid modification, weight loss (BMI >30)

criterion: Pelvic floor training for urinary incontinence in women
condition: Stress or mixed urinary incontinence in women
recommendation: START supervised pelvic floor training ≥3 months

criterion: Bladder training for urinary incontinence
condition: Urgency or mixed urinary incontinence in women

criterion: Allopurinol with recurrent gout
condition: History of recurrent episodes of gout

criterion: DMARD for active rheumatoid arthritis
Folic acid with methotrexate
recommendation: START folic acid per local shared care guideline

criterion: Gastroprotection for NSAID users
Activity and exercise advice for osteoarthritis and back pain
recommendation: START fitness/exercise advice, including weight loss if applicable

criterion: Topical prostaglandin/prostamide/beta-blocker for primary open-angle glaucoma
Nutrition support for malnourished or at-risk patients
drug_class: Dietary advice, food fortification, or supplements
condition: Malnourished or at risk of malnutrition
recommendation: START nutrition support on dietetic advice
